Class addflight

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JInternalFrame
            • addflight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class addflight
extends javax.swing.JInternalFrame
    addFlight is a class designed to construct Flight objects and insert their data into 'airline' database.

    A flight requires fields such as a departing and source location, a time of departure, arrival time, and a date of the flight itself. Most importantly, each flight is given a unique flight ID by the system, via the autoID() method. jButton1 is the 'Add' button, which will grab values input by a user in the appropriate fields on the 'Add Flight' screen and then construct a Flight object from them. Then it will insert the values of that Flight's attributes into the 'airline' database's 'Flight' table.

    See Also:
    autoID(), Serialized Form

      • jButton1ActionPerformed

        private void jButton1ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        This method is tied to the 'Add' button on the 'Add Flight' screen accessed from the Main screen.

        When a user presses the 'Add' button, the values that have been provided by the user in the appropriate text fields, date picker, and such will be grabbed and put into variable form. Then, these newly set variables will be passed as arguments into the addFlight method.

        Parameters:
        evt - An ActionListener that is invoked when the 'Add' button (jButton1) is pressed.
        See Also:
        addFlight()

      • autoID

        public void autoID()
        This method automatically generates an ID for a flight before they are added to the system.

        First, the method establishes a connection with the 'airline' database to look at the flight table. It uses a query to select the highest ID value saved in the database. If the flight table within the 'airline' database is completely empty, then this method will assign the next created flight object to have the staring ID, FO001. By grabbing the highest ID value each time and incrementing it, the system prevents two flights from having identical IDs. This also means the user is unable to tamper with ID values while running the program.

      • addFlight

        public void addFlight(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String flightname,
                      java.lang.String source,
                      java.lang.String depart,
                      java.lang.String date,
                      java.lang.String departtime,
                      java.lang.String arrtime,
                      java.lang.String flightcharge)
        addFlight is a method that is designed to insert Flight objects into 'airline' database.

        First a statement is constructed using the values that have been passed in as parameters to addFlight. Every field must be filled out before a Flight object is inserted into the database otherwise an error will occur. If all of the passed parameters contain valid strings, then the statement can successfully execute and insert a Flight into the database with values corresponding to the ones passed in as parameters.

        Parameters:
        id - A string that contains the ID of the flight to add into the database.
        flightname - A string that contains the name of the flight being added into the database.
        source - A string containing the source location of the flight being added
        depart - A string containing the departure location of the flight to be added
        date - A string that describes the date of the flight's departure
        departtime - A string that tells what time a flight will be departing
        arrtime - A string explaining what time a flight will be arriving
        flightcharge - A string that describes the cost of the flight.

      • jButton2ActionPerformed

        private void jButton2ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        This method closes the 'Add Flight' screen and returns a user to the 'Main' screen.
        Parameters:
        evt - An ActionListener tied to jButton2, the 'Cancel' button.
